title: The Different Types Of Mediation
summary: There are many different types of mediation, each with its own set of rules and expectations for participants. General mediation can be used in a wide variety of situations, including landlord-tenant disputes, divorces, contract issues, and many other types of disputes. In most cases, general mediation is an appropriate option for parties who want to resolve their dispute without going to court. The mediator is not an advocate or decision-maker, but a neutral third party who facilitates communication between the disputing parties.

relatedArticles.title: What Are the Drawbacks of Mediation?

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is a great option for resolving disputes and reducing the stress of a legal conflict. It\u2019t also less expensive than going to court and doesn\u2019t give your opponent any negative information that could be used against you in the future. The only potential drawback to mediation is that it requires both parties to agree on an outcome they are happy with. If one party feels like they have no other options, they may not be willing to mediate. However, this should not stop you from exploring this option further.
Mediation has many benefits over other methods of dispute resolution, such as negotiation and arbitration. However, every type of settlement has its drawbacks. Read on to learn more about the pros and cons of mediation as a dispute resolution technique:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog Not to Chew on Household Items

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Are you ready to give up chewing on household objects? How about your dog? Dogs love to chew. It\u2019s something that comes naturally for them, and there are many things you can buy or make that will help satisfy their natural instincts to chew. But as much as dogs love to have objects that they can gnaw on, it\u2019s not always safe \u2013 or advisable \u2013 to let them do it in the home. There are plenty of household items that dogs shouldn\u2019t be allowed to chew, because it could lead to potential hazards or unsanitary conditions.
Even if your dog has never chewed on inappropriate things before, a new puppy will almost certainly try out things beyond what is safe for him. How you train him from the very beginning will determine how much damage he can do if he goes after something he shouldn\u2019t. So read on and learn how to stop your dog from chewing on anything other than his own toys.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Top New Woodworking Projects to Keep You Busy This Winter

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Let\u2019s face it \u2013 the winter season can get pretty monotonous and lonely. When the temperature drops and snow begins to pile up, it can be easy for your home to feel like a cold, unforgiving prison. As much as we love cozying up by the fire with hot chocolate and blankets, there has to be something more constructive that you can do in order to break out of this winter funk.
If you want to stay productive this winter and keep from going crazy from cabin fever, now is the perfect time to start focusing on different woodworking projects. Hopefully these will not only keep you busy but also help combat those seasonal blues. Check out these 5 popular new woodworking projects that are sure to keep you busy this winter!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Top 10 Funniest Cat Videos on Youtube

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Why do crazy cat people love their cats so much? Because their cats are hilarious. With their constant sneering and condescending glares, feline friends have a knack for being entertaining in the most ridiculous ways. So, if you need a break from those stressful final exam cram sessions, we've compiled a list of the top 10 funniest cat videos on YouTube. From silly cats to crafty cats and everything in between, these videos will give you some much-needed LOLs.
Cat videos are one of the most popular video niches online today. There are several channels on YouTube that are dedicated only to cat videos and nothing else. In this post we\u2019ll look at some of the best channels that feature nothing but cat content \u2013 be it funny cat vines or cute cat compilations \u2013 as well as some of our favorite individual clips from these creators.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to Cut down on Screen Time
How to Train Your Dog to Heel
What Are the Success Rates of Mediation?

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is a dispute resolution process that involves the participation of a neutral third party called a mediator. The parties to the dispute agree to meet with the mediator and disclose facts, but not argue their case. Instead, the goal is for both sides to listen carefully to what the other has to say and explore possible compromises that are agreeable to both.
Mediation can be used at any stage of a dispute, from resolving initial grievances through settlement or arbitration. It can be used instead of litigation when there\u2019s no clear right or wrong side or when it\u2019s more cost-effective than adversarial proceedings. Research shows mediation can also make disputes last much shorter and cheaper than trials, reduce risk of lawsuits being refilled after settlement, and increase the likelihood of reaching an agreement in principle between parties.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Top 10 Best Cat Breeds in the World

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Cats are mysterious creatures, it\u2019s almost impossible to know what they\u2019re thinking. But that hasn\u2019t stopped cat lovers from all over the world falling head over heels in love with these cuddly felines. Whether you like them for their beauty, intelligence or simply for their cuteness, there is no denying that cats make wonderful pets.
There are a wide range of different breeds of cat but generally speaking there are two main categories; longhaired and shorthaired cats. Within these two groups there are numerous sub-groups and hybrids with specific traits from different types of cat \u2013 check out this article to learn more about the basic types of cat!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with a Partner Who's Always Working

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Working too much is a problem many people struggle with \u2014 but it\u2019s even more challenging when you\u2019re in a relationship with someone who has the same work ethic. If your partner usually leaves for work before you even get out of bed, or isn\u2019t home until after you\u2019re already in bed, things can get tricky.
Working from home, flexible hours and remote working are all buzzwords in today\u2019s labor market. Companies are becoming increasingly aware that it isn\u2019t just about how much time employees spend at the desk but also about what they achieve during that time. A Gallup poll found that telecommuting or working from home is growing in popularity among professionals across most industries. Working remotely makes it easier to find jobs, negotiate schedules and live without a commute.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
